title: Communicating Social Issues in Singapore
description:
The course covers various frameworks including
community-based participatory approaches and
community development models, which focus
students on the practices and theories of
communicating for social change. Fundamentally,
communication for social change and community
participation are understood from the perspectives of
social marketing, social mobilization, entertainment-education, media advocacy, information
dissemination, and behaviour change. The literature
behind participatory approaches of the social process
of communication that impact the community
development process will be highlighted. The course
is tailored to address various social issues in
Singapore.
department: Chua Thian Poh Comm Leader Center
